content.description:
See Guidebook: "Quadra Island Rock Climbs" by Philip Stone

Can link pitches and lower off with 70m (can lower/rap with a 60m, but knot ends and trend climber’s right to land on the ledge with the fixed line at the base of Sulphur Slab)



Just right of "Sunset Strip" on a mossy ledge climber's left of a big fir tree.


12 bolts + rap rings. Anchor bolts are offset so use slings to equalize.

A really enjoyable climb on great rock and an interesting feature. Start scrambling to the left up a short step and corner to a ledge below a V-shaped face. Gain the face proper with a committing move to make the third clip (5.8+). Climb direct on superb rock with a couple of puzzles to solve. Either belay at the first anchor or romp up another 12m (30ft) of 4th to low 5th class to the top. 



From the base of the centre of Sunset Slab head left stepping up onto a narrow mossy ledge with a few small trees. Follow the ledge to an alcove below a steep wall, 2 bolt bottom anchor.

P1 8 bolts - rappel ring anchor, P2 3 bolts - rappel ring anchor.

Start with a tricky (5.8) move stepping up a short corner to gain a left-trending ramp. Follow the ramp left then leave the ramp moving right onto a short slab. Pull up onto another short slab. Cross the slab and turn right to a head wall. Climb the head wall (5.8) to easier climbing. Finish at the higher of two anchors (shared with Sunset Strip) if occupied use the lower station. 



Start just a few metres left of the start of Sunset Strip on a mossy ledge with a few small trees. Look for the undercut ramp heading right to left.

10 bolts - rappel ring anchor

See Guidebook: "Quadra Island Rock Climbs" by Philip Stone

Caution: hollow flakes near bolts 10/11



Rightmost bolted route on Sunset Slab Lefthand. Scramble up to a sloping ledge with a short fixed line on a birch tree (belayer can stay below).

12 bolts + rap rings. Use a couple of alpine draws for bolts 10/11.

climbs.name: Sunset Strip
climbs.fa: Philip Stone, Greg Shea, & Mick Bromley, 14 April 2014

content.description:
See Guidebook: "Quadra Island Rock Climbs" by Philip Stone



Just left of "A Dream of Wild Onions" on a mossy ledge climber's left of a big fir tree.

12 bolts + rap rings. Anchor bolts are offset so use slings to equalize.
Fantastic area for new leaders. Partial shade at the base most of the day.
